member.name: T:C1.Win.C1Themes.Shared.ThemeBrushBase
member.summary: Abstract base class for all classes representing a brush in a theme. Use the method to get an actual matching GDI+ brush. Classes derived from override Equals() and GetHashCode() methods and compare objects by content rather than by references.

member.summary: Creates an exact copy of this .
member.returns: The this method creates.

member.name: M:C1.Win.C1Themes.Shared.ThemeBrushBase.GetBrush(System.Drawing.Rectangle)
member.summary: Returns a GDI+ brush matching the theme brush. It is the caller's responsibility to dispose this brush when it is no longer needed.
member.param: The brush rectangle (used for gradient brushes).
member.returns: The GDI+ object.

member.name: M:C1.Win.C1Themes.Shared.ThemeBrushBase.DependOnRect
member.summary: Returns true if a GDI+ brush created for this theme brush depends on the rectangle passed to the method. E.g. gradient brushes return true in this method while solid return false.
member.returns: True if the GDI+ brush depends on the application area, false otherwise.

member.name: M:C1.Win.C1Themes.Shared.ThemeBrushBase.EncodeToString
member.returns: String represengin this object.

member.summary: Checks whether the two objects are equal by value (i.e. represent identically described theme brushes).
member.returns: True if the two brushes are identical, or are both null.

member.name: P:C1.Win.C1Themes.Shared.ThemeBrushHelper.ForeignBrush
member.summary: Gets or sets a brush object which is stored but not managed by this ThemeBrushHelper - i.e. it will not be disposed when this ThemeBrushHelper is disposed, or a new brush is assigned to it. Note that while the 'get' accessor is provided for this property, there is no need to use it - just use the method to get a usable GDI+ brush.

member.name: M:C1.Util.Licensing.AboutForm.Dispose(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Clean up any resources being used.
member.param: true if managed resources should be disposed; otherwise, false.

member.name: M:C1.Util.Licensing.AboutForm.InitializeComponent
member.summary: Required method for Designer support - do not modify the contents of this method with the code editor.

summary.para: Provides static methods that should be called from the constructors of licensed classes.
Also provides a static method that can be called to show the about box with product and licensing information.

member.name: M:C1.Util.Licensing.ProviderInfo.Validate(System.Type,System.Object)
member.summary: Perform license validation. Call this method from the licensed object's constructor to save a license key at design time, validate it at runtime, and display a nag dialog if a valid license is not found.
member.param: Type of licensed object (use typeof() and not GetType()).
Reference to the licensed object (not currently used).
member.returns: A object that contains information about the license.

remarks.para: Check the ShouldNag property of the returned to determine whether the licensed class should nag the user. This value is set to true in situations where a valid license was not found but a nag dialog could not be displayed. In these cases, the licensed class is supposed to nag in some other way (with a watermark for example).

member.name: M:C1.Util.Licensing.ProviderInfo.Validate(System.Type,System.Object,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Perform license validation. Call this method from the licensed object's constructor to save a license key at design time, validate it at runtime, and display a nag dialog if a valid license is not found.
member.param: Type of licensed object (use typeof() and not GetType()).
Reference to the licensed object (not currently used).
Whether the nag dialog should be displayed when a valid license is not found.
member.returns: A object that contains information about the license.

remarks.para: This overload was created for use in WPF. It should be called in the control's constructor in order to support license persistence correctly. But it should not show the nag dialog until the control is fully loaded, or the VS designer may remain blank.

member.name: M:C1.Util.Licensing.ProviderInfo.Nag(System.Type,C1.Util.Licensing.LicenseInfo,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Nag user by showing AboutBox with license information. Show it only once per day per assembly.
member.param: Type of licensed object (use typeof() and not GetType()).
object that contains information about the license.
Whether we're running at design or run time.

member.name: M:C1.Util.Licensing.ProviderInfo.Validate(System.Type,System.Object,System.Reflection.Assembly,System.String)
member.summary: Version of Validate used by constructors that take runtime keys.
member.param: Type of licensed object (use typeof() and not GetType()).
Assembly that contains the owner licensed control.
member.returns: A with information about the runtime key.

remarks.para: This allows a licensed C1 class to create other C1 objects bypassing license verification for the child objects.
For extra safety, we check that the owner object is defined in an assembly the contains a 'C1ProductInfo' attribute.

member.name: M:C1.Util.Licensing.ProviderInfo.ValidateDesigntime(System.Type,System.ComponentModel.LicenseContext)
member.summary: Design time validation. Looks for a license in the registry and saves it in the provided .
member.param: Type of licensed object (use typeof() and not GetType()).
where the runtime key will be stored.
member.returns: A with information about the license.
member.remarks: Call this method from application-type products (that always require a license to be installed in the registry). In this case, the parameter should be set to null.

member.name: M:C1.Util.Licensing.ProviderInfo.ValidateRuntime(System.Type,System.ComponentModel.LicenseContext)
member.summary: Runtime validation. Looks for a runtime key stored in the current application's resources.
member.param: Type of licensed object (use typeof() and not GetType()).
where the runtime key will be stored.
member.returns: A with information about the license.

member.name: M:C1.Util.Licensing.ProviderInfo.ShowAboutBox(System.Object)
member.summary: Shows the About Box for an instance of a C1 product.

member.summary: Get the type whose assembly contains a 'C1ProductInfoAttribute'.
member.param: Instance of an object whose type is to be checked.
member.returns: The type whose assembly contains a 'C1ProductInfoAttribute'

member.summary: Gets the number of evaluation days elapsed. Returns -1 for valid licenses.

member.summary: Gets the number of evaluation days still left.

member.name: P:C1.Util.Licensing.LicenseInfo.ShouldNag
member.summary: Gets or sets a value that determines whether the caller should nag the user. This is the case when the component/control is not licensed, but is not running in interactive mode. So we can't show a dialog and the caller is supposed to nag some other way (typically by adding watermarks to the UI or output).

member.name: P:C1.Util.Licensing.LicenseInfo.IsValid
member.summary: Gets a value that determines whether the license found is valid.

member.name: P:C1.Util.Licensing.LicenseInfo.IsExpired
member.summary: Gets a value that determines whether the license found is expired.

member.name: P:C1.Util.Licensing.LicenseInfo.IsLocalHost
member.summary: Gets a value that determines whether the component is running under localhost and therefore should not nag the user with alert dialogs.

member.name: T:C1.Util.Licensing.SafeLicenseContext
member.summary:
Provides a version of GetSavedLicenseKey that doesn't require special permissions.
The code was mostly copied from the .NET framework, but then changed in a few places to require fewer permissions (assembly name, file io, etc).
The main change is the use of a custom deserializer to read Hashtable objects instead of the original BinaryFormatter, which requires permissions.

member.name: T:C1.Util.Licensing.C1AboutNameAttribute
member.summary: Attribute used to specify the product name shown on the About Box.

member.name: T:C1.Util.Licensing.C1AllowedCallerAttribute
member.summary: Attribute used to specify assemblies that can use this product without a license.

member.name: T:C1.Util.Licensing.C1ProductInfoAttribute
member.summary: Attribute used to attach licensing/product information to assemblies.

member.name: T:C1.Util.Licensing.ProductLicense
member.summary:
Represents a license for a product (e.g. C1BarCode, C1Studio Enterprise).
Provides methods for: - generating new license keys (administrative task) - checking license key validity (used by installer and products) - generating and checking runtime keys (used by products) - installing/uninstalling licenses (used by installer)
The install/uninstall code requires elevated permissions, and is used only by setups and utilities (not by controls). The code is implemented in the ProductLicense.Installer.cs, which controls should not include since it won't be useful to them.
When a product is sold, we send the user a license KEY. The user installs a license on his machine by providing his name, his company name, and the key.
The is a string in the following format:
AAQYYCC-XX-NNNNNN-DD-DZZZZZZ
Where:
AA: Product code (should match one of the products in the product catalog (see ProductInformation.GetProductCatalog()). Q: Quarter when the license key was issued (1, 2, or 3) YY: Year when the license key was issued (e.g., 10 for 2010) CC: Order code, two chars that indicate whether this is a new sale, upgrade, renewal, special offer, etc. XX: Hash code to ensure key validity. NNNNNN: Unique serial number. DDD: Vendor code, three chars ZZZZZZ: Combination of random numbers for uniqueness and extra hash.

member.name: F:C1.Util.Licensing.VersionConst.VerString
member.summary: WinForms version string representation (4 dot-delimited numbers).

member.name: T:C1.Util.Licensing.AssemblyNames
member.summary: Specifies assembly name parts, used by AssemblyCommonInfo to generate actual assembly names.

member.name: M:GrapeCity.Common.GcNetFxLicenseProvider`1.VerifyDesignTimeEnvironment
member.summary: Verify the environment to get whether the component is in design-time.
member.returns: true if it is in design-time; otherwise false.
member.remarks: In DesignTime, because of IDE bugs, some component are not created with DesigntimeLicenseContext. For example, when drag a control from Win Forms DataSource tool window, or use a web control in a ASP.NET Template. This may cause the control do run-time license validation and found that there is no license. To resolve this problem, we will check the environment and decide whether to do design-time license validation again.

member.name: M:GrapeCity.Common.LicenseDialog`1.Dispose(System.Boolean)

member.summary: Info dialog. It is shown for a trial license.

member.summary: Warning dialog. It is shown for a trial license which is expired.
